column9: I was swithced from Verapamil 80 mg to Carvedilol 6.25mg because of severe consitpation. But I wonder if it was worth it, because I have severe constipation with Carvedilol as well.  At least when taking Verapamil my Bp was coming down-but with Carvedilol, I have had numerous bouts with lightheadedness, tingling arms, hands, legs, feet, major fluid retention around ankles, muscle cramps, legs feel heavy, I have also gained 41 pounds in the last 6 months. I also have erectile dysfunction along with shedding of hair! I want to get off this med ASAP only problem is not having a doctor that is concerned with overall condition due to a lack of insurance! I go to a clinic which services elderly and poor on a sliding scale fee and everytime I remind them of my conditions the doctor suggests that I find a private doctor or obtain private insurance or get a better job that offers insurance so that he can make referrals otherwise he doesn't want to hear it! I wonder how he would feel if this happened to him? I also noticed that most of the reviews left by men on this site have a tendency to complain of side effects-wonder if this is medication is more sensitive to the male body?? Just a thought?

column2: cj, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have had great success with this drug.  I have myocardial infraction, whose onset was sudden as was a weight gain for 30 pounds in one month. (152 to 184) I had a pacemaker and defibrillator implanted and put on carvedilol at 25mg twice a day with enalapril 2.5 mg twice a day.  I lost ten pounds a month after surgery (3 years ago) and have not been able to lose the rest even with exercise daily.  Never had a weight problem, oh well, this could be from taking other meds as well.  I began feeling better immediately and am still eating healthy. I have none of the side effects and have not gained any weight.  I will stay on it as my cardiologist recommends.  I feel more alive and have more energy than before taking it.  My blood pressure is always in the 120/60 range which is goo.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I had an Ejection Fraction of 15 when I started carvedilol.  My EF became normal within six months.Side effects (dizzyness mostly) were not serious and decreased over time.  The first few weeks on this drug were pretty rough but I felt much better in a couple of months.Now that I have a normal EF, I can have a more normal life.  Carvedilol has saved my life.  Once my symptoms improved, the side effects diminished.   There will always be more fatigue and dizzyness than normal because of the combination of heart failure and the medication but side effects do get easier over time.
